DOC.brief_title: Percutaneous Treatment LONG Native Coronary Lesions With Drug-Eluting Stent-III ( LONG-DES-III )
DOC.detailed_description: Following angiography , patient significant diameter stenosis > 50 % lesion length ( > 25mm ) require single multiple long-stent placement ( total stent length > 28mm ) visual estimation eligible LONG-DES III trial inclusion exclusion criterion randomize 1:1 ) sirolimus-eluting b ) everolimus-eluting stent stratify randomization method .
DOC.criteria: The patient must least 18 year age . Significant native coronary artery stenosis ( > 50 % visual estimate ) lesion length 25mm , require single multiple long stent placement ( > =28mm ) Patients silent ischemia , stable unstable angina pectoris , ad NonSTelevation myocardial infarction The patient guardian agree study protocol schedule clinical angiographic followup , provide informed , write consent , approve appropriate Institutional Review Board/Ethical Committee respective clinical site . Any contraindication follow medication : aspirin , heparin , clopidogrel , stainless steel , contrast agent , sirolimus , everolimus . An elective surgical procedure plan would necessitate interruption antiplatelet drug first 6 month post enrollment . Acute STsegmentelevation MI cardiogenic shock Terminal illness life expectancy < 1 year Patients actively participate another drug device investigational study , complete primary endpoint followup period . Instent restenosis target vessel ( either bare metal stent drugeluting stent segment , nontarget vessel ISR permit ) Patients EF < 30 % . Serum creatinine level > =3.0mg/dL dependence dialysis . Patients leave main stem stenosis ( > 50 % visual estimate ) .
